Message.Title: SC SBR triggered
Message.Description: Safe Brake Ramp (SBR) on Safety Controller (SC) was interrupted by a Class 0 stop due to slow deceleration on Mechanical unit . This is normal and occurs in cases when a stop1 is to slow. Check for other safety controller elog.
Message.Actions:
- Change parameter value for SBR in Motion configuration
- Trigger a new stop to test the Brake Ramp.
- If this happens frequently, check the Application manual for Mechanical units configuration.

Message.Title: SC Tool change incorrect
Message.Description: Incorrect tool change with Tool on Mechanical unit
Message.Actions:
- Check if correct tool.
- Decrease speed if needed.
- Perform a new tool change.

Message.Title: ES panel open
Message.Description: The emergency stop panel has previously been broken, and while broken, an attempt was made to operate the robot.
Message.Consequences: The system remains in the Emergency Stop status.
Message.Causes: An attempt has been made to manoeuvre a control, e.g. the enabling device.
Message.Actions:
1) To resume operation, first reset the emergency stop panel button.
2) Then switch the system back to state Motors ON by pressing the Motors ON button on the Control Module.

Message.Title: ES pendant open
Message.Description: The emergency stop pendant has previously been broken, and while broken, an attempt was made to operate the robot.
Message.Consequences: The system remains in the Emergency Stop status.
Message.Causes: An attempt has been made to manoeuvre a control, e.g. the enabling device.
Message.Actions:
1) To resume operation, first reset the emergency stop pendant button.
2) Then switch the system back to state Motors ON by pressing the Motors ON button on the Control Module.

Message.Title: ES ext.cat.0 open
Message.Description: The emergency stop external has previously been broken, and while broken, an attempt was made to operate the robot.
Message.Consequences: The system remains in the Emergency Stop status.
Message.Causes: An attempt has been made to manoeuvre a control, e.g. the enabling device.
Message.Actions:
1) To resume operation, first reset the emergency stop external button.
2) Then switch the system back to state Motors ON by pressing the Motors ON button on the Control Module.

Message.Title: Delayed stop open
Message.Description: Delayed stop open.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1) To resume operation, first reset the delayed stop button.
2) Then switch the system back to state Motors ON by pressing the Motors ON button on the Control Module.

Message.Title: Test Stop open
Message.Description: The Test Mode Safeguarded Stop circuit has been broken.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: One or more of the switch connected in series with the Test Mode Safeguarded Stop circuit have been opened, which may be causes by a large number of faults. This is only possible while in the Manual operational mode
Message.Actions:
1) Locate the switch, reset it and restart the system.
2) Check cables and connections.

Message.Title: Hardware chain open
Message.Description: Relays (KA16 and KA17) on Safety Interface Board (SIB) not activated.
Message.Consequences: Motor on command rejected.
Message.Actions: Press motor ON button to close the chain.

Message.Title: Test Stop conflict
Message.Description: Status conflict for the Test Stop chain.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Please check the two-channel safety guard that caused the status conflict.

Message.Title: ES panel conflict
Message.Description: Status conflict for the Emergency Stop panel chain.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status emergency stop.
Message.Actions: Please check the two-channel safety guard that caused the status conflict.

Message.Title: ES pendant conflict
Message.Description: Status conflict for the Emergency Stop pendant chain.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status emergency stop.
Message.Actions: Please check the two-channel safety guard that caused the status conflict.

Message.Title: ES ext.cat.0 conflict
Message.Description: Status conflict for the Emergency Stop ext.cat.0 chain.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status emergency stop.
Message.Actions: Please check the two-channel safety guard that caused the status conflict.

Message.Title: HV Interlock input conflict
Message.Description: Only one of the two input signals in the high voltage chains is opened.
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Please check the two-channel safety guard that caused the status conflict.

Message.Title: Cabin Interlock input conflict
Message.Description: Only one of the two input signals in cabin interlock chains is opened.
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Check cables and connections.

Message.Title: Delayed Stop conflict
Message.Description: Status conflict for the delayed stop circuit.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check cables and connections.

Message.Title: Mode selector conflict
Message.Description: Any of the connections to the mode selector are faulty.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check cables and connections.

Message.Title: AUX Interlock conflict
Message.Description: Only one of the two AUX interlock chains was opened. Normally used on CBS door interlock.
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Check cables and connections.

Message.Title: Motor on chain conflict
Message.Description: Only one of the two motor on chain signals in run chain is opened.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check cables and connections.

Message.Title: Glitch test fault
Message.Description: Status active when firmware on Process Interface Board (PIB) did not detect any glitch test pulse for 30 seconds.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check other error messages for primary fault reason.
2. Check for communication problems between PIB and Main Computer (MC).

Message.Title: Enable 2 AXC 1 open
Message.Description: Status active when enable from Axis Computer 1 open.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check other error messages for primary fault reason.
2. If no other error messages, please check line voltage for one phase missing.

Message.Title: Enable 2 AXC 2 open
Message.Description: Status active when enable from Axis Computer 2 open.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check other error messages for primary fault reason.
2. If no other error messages, please check line voltage for one phase missing.

Message.Title: Manipulator fault
Message.Description: Status active when power to manipulator connected to Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) is lost, or manipulator's enable chain conditions is not OK.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check the power to the manipulator.
2. Check that the enable chain on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB/MCB) is OK.
3. Check for over temperature in Manipulator motors.
4. Check manipulator signals through Power Distribution Board (PDB). See the Circuit Diagram.

Message.Title: Collision sensor active
Message.Description: Status active when digital collision sensor on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB) is active.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check the collision sensors connected to MCOB.

Message.Title: Axis limit on MCOB
Message.Description: Status active when limit sensor on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB) is active.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check the limit sensors connected to MCOB.

Message.Title: Manipulator software has opened enable chain
Message.Description: Status active when Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB/MCB) software has opened the enable chain.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check other error messages for primary fault reason.
2. Check for brake fault.

Message.Title: Reset ES fault
Message.Description: Status active when Reset Emergency Stop input is activated for more than 3 seconds.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check the connection of external reset of Emergency Stop.
2. Check the motor on push button.

Message.Title: Servo disconnect open
Message.Description: Status active when Servo disconnect switch on system is off.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: If Servo disconnect switch is not installed, check the disable link on Manipulator Interface Board (MIB).

Message.Title: Brake rel. on axes 1 & 7
Message.Description: Status active when manual brake release on axes 1 and 7 enabled.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check switch for manual brake release of axes 1 and 7.

Message.Title: External enable 1 open
Message.Description: Status active when external enable 1 on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB) is open.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check connection on MCCB X25.

Message.Title: External enable 2 open
Message.Description: Status active when external enable 2 on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB) is open.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check connection on MCCB X43.

Message.Title: Power low on MCOB
Message.Description: Status active when power below 16V on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB) .
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check power on MCOB.

Message.Title: Hardware enable open on MCOB/MCB
Message.Description: Status active when firmware on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB/MCB) has opened the enable chain.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.

Message.Title: Watchdog fault on MCOB/MCB
Message.Description: Status active when watchdog on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB/MCB) fails.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.

Message.Title: TPU wiring error
Message.Description: Status active when Process Interface Board (PIB) detects fault on emergency stop pendant and enabling device signals (glitch test).
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check cables and connections to Teach Pendant Unit (TPU).
2. Check Pendant Interface Board (TIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB).

Message.Title: HV Interlock open
Message.Description: Paint system High Voltage (HV) interlock is opened by external interlock connection.
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Check manual switch for disconnecting of the HV system.

Message.Title: Cabin Interlock open
Message.Description: Cabin Interlock is opened by external interlock connection.
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Check cabin ventilation and other cabin safety functions.

Message.Title: Controller ID is Missing
Message.Description: Controller ID is the controller's unique identity. It is by default equal to the serial number of the controller's cabinet. The software configuration of the controller is missing this identity information.
Message.Causes: This may happen if the storage media of the controller has been replaced or reformatted.
Message.Actions: Read the serial number of the controller from the controller cabinet to find out what the controller ID should be. Use RobotStudio tools to set this value for the controller.

Message.Title: Process Interlock open
Message.Description: Process Interlock is opened by external interlock connection.
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Check manual switch for disconnecting of the process system.

Message.Title: AUX Interlock open
Message.Description: AUX Interlock is opened by external interlock connection. Normally used for Cartridge Bell System (CBS).
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Check cables and equipments connected to AUX inputs.

Message.Title: System 2 Interlock open
Message.Description: System 2 Interlock is opened. Normally used for Cartridge Bell System (CBS) or paint pumps
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Check cables and equipments connected to system 2.

Message.Title: HV ON open
Message.Description: High Voltage (HV) switch on operating panel is opened.
Message.Consequences: Paint enable chain opens.
Message.Actions: Give acknowledge on motor ON and switch on the HV key to close the HV interlock chain.

Message.Title: SPI communication towards SIB is down
Message.Description: Status active when cyclic enable 1 test fails from Safety Interface Board (SIB).
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check status on Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) status.
2. Check cables between Process Interface Board (PIB) abd SIB.

Message.Title: SPI communication towards MIB is down
Message.Description: Status active when cyclic enable 1 test fails from Manipulator Interface Board (MIB) .
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
Check cables and Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) status.
2. Check cables between SIB and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB).

Message.Title: Watchdog towards PIB software fails
Message.Description: Status active when firmware on Process Interface Board (PIB) discover watchdog fault between PIB firmware and PIB software.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: Too high processor load on PIB software.

Message.Title: Fault on internal SPI
Message.Description: Status active when firmware on Process Interface Board (PIB) discover watchdog fault towards Safety Interface Board (SIB) and Manipulator Interface Board (MIB).
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: Serial Peripheral Interface (SPI) communication is down on SPI 1.
Message.Actions: Check cables between PIB, SIB and MIB.

Message.Title: Enable chain opened from IPS
Message.Description: Status active when enable chain is opened from signal Safety/PibSw/Enable.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check the actuator connected to signal Safety/PibSw/Enable.

Message.Title: Watchdog fault towards PIB firmware
Message.Description: Status active when software on Process Interface Board (PIB) discover watchdog fault towards PIB firmware caused by fault on FPGA.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.

Message.Title: Watchdog fault towards PIB firmware
Message.Description: Status active when software on Process Interface Board (PIB) discover watchdog fault towards PIB firmware caused by fault on the In-System Micro Controller.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.

Message.Title: Watchdog fault between PIB and MC
Message.Description: Process Interface Board (PIB) has detected a watchdog fault towards Main Computer (MC).
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes:
1. Broken ethernet cable between PIB and MC.
2. High network load.
Message.Actions:
If problem persists:
1. Check MC.
2. Check ethernet cable between PIB and MC.
3. Restart controller.

Message.Title: Watchdog fault between PIB and MCOB
Message.Description: Status active when agent connection on CAN between Process Interface Board (PIB) and Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB) is down.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions:
1. Check CAN cables.
2. Check MCOB status.

Message.Title: Open circuit mask not set
Message.Description: The open circuit mask for brakes on Manipulator Controller Board (MCOB/MCB) is not set. The mask should be set from Process Interface Board (PIB) during start-up.
Message.Consequences: This message will be given every time the brakes are released, until the open circuit mask on MCOB/MCB is set.
Message.Causes: IPS configuration on PIB is not loaded or configuration file for brake settings is missing.
Message.Actions:
1. Check that IPS configuration is loaded during start-up.
2. Check that IPS configuration file for brake settings are installed on PIB.

Message.Title: TPU hot plug timeout
Message.Description: The TPU hot plug button is pressed for too long time.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Press motor ON button to close the chain.

Message.Title: External process enable open
Message.Description: Status active when external process enable connection on Manipulator Controller Board (MCB) is open.
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check connection on MCB X2.

Message.Title: IO power low on MCB
Message.Description: Status active when IO power below 16V on Manipulator Controller Board (MCB) .
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS HALT.
Message.Actions: Check power on MCB.

Message.Title: Communication fault between PIB and MC
Message.Description: Process Interface Board (PIB) has detected a communication fault towards Main Computer (MC).
Message.Consequences: The system goes to status SYS FAIL.
Message.Causes:
1. Broken ethernet cable between PIB and MC.
2. High network load.
Message.Actions:
1. Check ethernet cable between PIB and MC.
2. Check MC.
3. Restart controller.

Message.Title: Unofficial RobotWare release
Message.Description:
The current RobotWare is not an officially supported release.
Unofficial RobotWare releases may only be used for time-limited test and validation purposes.
Message.Consequences: ABB will not provide long-term support on unofficial releases.
Message.Actions: If this is a production system, install an official RobotWare release as soon as possible.

Message.Title: Too long paths when unpacking RobotWare files
Message.Description:
The RobotWare installation package was not properly unpacked on the controller. Some files in the package have a path that is too long and could not be handled by the controller software.
During the installation process the controller software was upgraded to handle longer paths, so a re-installation of the system should solve the problem.
Message.Consequences: Some RobotWare files are missing on the controller and your system may not be able to operate properly.
Message.Actions: Re-install the system by using SystemBuilder. If the error is still present after the re-installation, contact customer support.

Message.Title: Unofficial RobotWare image
Message.Description: The current RobotWare main computer image is not the original, and is hence not officially supported.
Message.Consequences: ABB will not provide long-term support on unofficial RobotWare releases.
Message.Causes: The officially released main computer image has been replaced, e.g., for the purpose of collecting diagnostic data for a specific problem.
Message.Actions: If this is a production system, install an official RobotWare release as soon as possible.

Message.Title: Motor phase short circuit
Message.Description: The drive unit for joint has reported short circuit. The joint is connected to drive module with unit position and node .
Message.Consequences: No operation will be possible until the fault is corrected. The system goes to Motors Off state with zero torque.
Message.Causes:
1) Short circuit in cables or connectors between the phases or to ground.
2) Short circuit in motor between the phases or to ground.
Message.Actions:
1) Check/replace cables and connectors.
2) Check/replace motor.

Message.Title: The system has entered an internal test mode
Message.Description: A feature to perform ABB Robotics internal tests has been enabled in .
Message.Consequences: The system may not behave as expected.
Message.Actions: Restart the system when the test has been performed. If this was an unexpected message, please contact your contact your local ABB representative for assistance.

Message.Title: Camera job is not valid
Message.Description: The camera is in running mode but the job loaded into it is not a valid ABB job.
Message.Consequences: All camera results will be lost.
Message.Causes: The camera job is not a valid ABB job or the parameters produced by the camera job for each acquired image has not been converted to RAPID variables.
Message.Actions:
- Set the camera in program mode. Load a valid ABB job into the camera or use Robot Studio to create one.
- In RobotStudio in the "Vision"-sheet, select "Output to RAPID" to convert parameters to RAPID variables.

Message.Title: Communication failure with camera
Message.Description: The robot controller failed to communicate with camera .
Message.Consequences: Camera results may be lost.
Message.Actions:
1) Check camera status.
2) Check cabling between the robot controller and the camera.

Message.Title: IP address of the camera has changed
Message.Description: The IP address of the camera has changed. It is necessary to warm start the controller to use the Integrated Vision functionality.
Message.Actions: Warm start the controller

Message.Title: Integrated Vision not installed
Message.Description: The option Integrated Vision is not installed on this system.
Message.Consequences: No communication with the camera is possible.
Message.Causes: The Integrated Vision functionality have been used or configured without the Integrated Vision option installed.
Message.Actions:
1) If the Integrated Vision option is needed: configure a new system with this option, and install the system.
2) If the Integrated Vision option is not needed: remove the use of Integrated Vision functionality, i.e. RAPID or configuration data.

Message.Title: No result for current camera job
Message.Description: The robot controller did not receive any result for camera .
Message.Consequences: The robot controller will not recognize any positional data in the image.
Message.Causes: No part tools have been defined for the current job loaded in camera .
Message.Actions: Use RobotStudio to add a Part Location Tool or a Part Inspection Tool to the job. Follow the instruction in the RobotStudio context menu and save the job.

Message.Title: Too many cameras connected
Message.Description: Number of cameras connected to the robot controller is . Max number of cameras for a robot controller is .
Message.Consequences: The robot controller will not communicate with all the cameras.
Message.Causes: Maximum number of cameras for a robot controller have been exceeded.
Message.Actions: Reduce the number of cameras connected to the robot controller.

Message.Title: Duplicated camera name
Message.Description: The camera configuration is invalid. The camera name have been used for more than one camera.
Message.Consequences: The robot controller will not communicate with cameras with the same name.
Message.Causes: Two or more cameras with the same name have been configured.
Message.Actions: Rename the cameras so that they have unique names and warm start the controller.
